Posts.Content: Hi - lung mets and brain mets can be nasty too. Have you found bcmets.org which is a forum for those with mets? If not, do have a look and try a posting there too. Chemo is nasty, but I always tell myself that it isn't for ever, and that each time it has put things into hold. It's the tiredness that wears me out.
Posts.Title: Metastic Breast Cancer Liv. Lung, Death Sentence

Posts.Content: Try posting your request on this forum, which is designed for young people coping with cancer problems http://www.riprap.org.uk/support/forums/show_groups.asp
Posts.Title: my Mom Was Diagnosed With Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Go and see your doctor asap. Probably benign, but you need to get it sorted.
Posts.Title: Cancer

Posts.Content: Hello, there seems massive disagreement on this one. Depends on whether the interpretation is taking antioxidants possibly will interfere or probably will interfere with the action of chemotherapy. My own research leans to the "possibly" side and so I take what I feel I need. However, it's worth remembering that we get Vit C from fruits and vegetables (and meat as well), so I would tend to take a smaller supplement than you seem to be thinking of. What treatment are you on? best wishes Phoebe
Posts.Title: Vit. c

Posts.Content: It's quite normal and totally easy, if a bit uncomfortable. Your boob is squashed between two plates while the scan is done. Don't know where you are, but results should be through within at most 10 days. If the system is efficient could be much quicker. No harm in asking the unit when the results will be available. Good luck - try not to worry. most lumps are benign.
Posts.Title: Help Me!

Posts.Content: Hello Janet, Without more information about your sister's cancer, it really isn't possible to have any opinion about status or treatment. If you can provide details of what kind of cancer, whether hse has had a mastectomy or lumpectomy, whether er/pr neg or positive, whether HER or not , which treatments she has already had, then some indication can be made as to what is happening.
Posts.Title: Should i be Concerned

Posts.Content: Contact the message board at bcmets.org. The participants all have metastatic breast cancer and are very knowledgable and helpful.
Posts.Title: i Need Your Help...

Posts.Content: This message board is good, but you could also try posting your query in the discussion groups of Breastcancer.org where there is a very responsive group. It is helpful to know which chemo you have had or are about to have.
Posts.Title: Wounds

Posts.Content: http://www.bcmets.org/ They also have a mailing list which is worth joining.
Posts.Title: i Need Your Help...

Posts.Content: It would be foolish to stop treatment now. There are many ways of holding off the development of cancers and many people live a long time with metastases. Join bcmets.org and discuss the situation with the many women who are in exactly this state and who know an enormous amount about how to handle it.
Posts.Title: Please Help Me!!
